job description:
Looking for a chance to show what you
can do in an environment that will appreciate you and help you grow? If
you are learning-oriented, strive for excellence, and have a strong customer
commitment, bring your talents to Independence Blue Cross as we seek to enhance
the health and well-being of the people and communities we serve. As a
member of Independence Health Group, we seek to innovate, reimagine and lead in
the transformation of healthcare. We are committed to attracting,
retaining and growing the best talent.

Independence
Blue Cross is seeking a data scientist to work in our dynamic, industry leading
Advanced Analytics team of researchers, analysts, and other data scientists. Our
goal is to develop advanced analytics solutions and inform strategies and
decisions that allow us to provide best-in-class service to our members through
access to affordable, high-quality health care.

The Advanced
Analytics team drives the full project lifecycle from consulting with the business
areas to understand their business needs, translating the business need into
predictive analytics, deploying models within the business, and conducting
evaluations of changes and interventions that were based on model outputs
(e.g., outreach interventions via text messages, Health Coach outreach calls,
product pricing, fraud, waste, and abuse and recoveries).

We have a leading-edge
data warehouse and computing environment with a robust suite of analytic
software. The candidate will have access to a wide range of data sources and
will apply predictive modeling and machine learning techniques within a Hadoop
framework. This role will require frequent interaction with project
stakeholders and business partners at all levels of the organization and offers
the opportunity to provide thought leadership and direction for analytic
solutions that inform business decisions.

Responsibilities:

· Have or develop
subject-matter expertise related to a wide array of data including medical and
pharmacy claims, prior authorization data, EMR data, lab results, and marketing
data.

· Collaborate with internal business areas and subject matter
experts (SMEs) to understand critical business questions, goals, and objectives
and translate into business opportunities to be captured
through predictive analytics solutions.

· Play a lead role within a cross-functional team of business
stakeholders, SMEs, analysts, and other data scientists in developing
delivering predictive analytics solutions.

· Develop predictive models across a variety of business areas
(e.g., clinical, pharmacy, marketing, product, and fraud detection) and deliver
and solutions to stakeholders.

· Execute and manage
analytics projects from inception and design through delivery, implementation,
and evaluation.

· Create meaningful data
visualizations & presentations to communicate findings in a way that
clearly links the business question to the analytic approach illustrates how
the results inform the business question.

· Test and learn new algorithms, models, software, and data
sources for continual improvement of quantitative solutions.

· Develop processes to implement feedback loops to improve
model quality over time.

· Drive proof of concept
tests of new data, software and technologies.

· Provides guidance to
other Health Analytics team members where relevant

Technical Skills:

· Expertise in using SQL,
R, Python, Scala etc. to manipulate large data sets and develop statistical
models.

· Expertise in data
management and modeling in an Hadoop environment, including use of Hive and
Spark for parallelized processing

· Ability to perform
feature engineering (transformation, binning, high level categorical reduction,
etc.) and validation (hold-outs, CV, bootstrap)

· Demonstrated experience
using analytical techniques for predictive modeling, including linear
regression, logistic regression, survival analysis, GLM, tree models (Random
Forests and GBM), cluster analysis, principal components, and deep learning
neural network models.

· Strong expertise in
regularization techniques (Ridge, Lasso, elastic nets)

· Proficiency in data
visualization.

· Familiarity with or
participation in the OHDSI community and experience with the OMOP common data
model a plus.

· Knowledge of SOLR and
Hbase a plus

Professional Skills:

· Must have a strong
customer focus, ability to work with internal clients and manage day-to-day
interactions with and expectations of business stakeholders

· Ability to lead
requirement gathering consultations with business stakeholders and translate
business needs into analytic problems.

· Strong understanding of
how analytic results inform or address a business problem or objectives and a
superior ability to communicate technical ideas and results to non-technical
clients in written and verbal form.

· Ability to lead projects in a team
environment, collaborating with various subject matter experts, management, analysts,
and other data scientist.

Qualifications:

· Masters or PhD (preferred) in Statistics,
Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Health
Economics, Epidemiology, Healthcare Informatics, or other relevant field
with additional coursework in machine learning, predictive
modeling and data management.

· 5+ years of work experience with health
care data analytics, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, machine
learning techniques, and visualization tools.

· Advanced knowledge of
health care industry, products, systems, business strategies and products

· Record of peer-reviewed
publications a plus.
